title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
A faster-than-expected recovery in domestic air travel is helping Boeing find new homes for unclaimed 737 MAX jets whose buyers walked away or collapsed during the pandemic.

---

McDonald's said hackers stole some data from its systems in markets including the U.S., South Korea and Taiwan, in another example of cybercriminals infiltrating high-profile firms.

---

A fresh wave of Covid-19 clusters in Asia is creating new bottlenecks in the global supply chain, threatening to push up prices and weigh on the post-pandemic recovery.

---

BP is working on a plan to spin off its operations in Iraq into a stand-alone company, part of its pivot toward lower-carbon energy.

---

A multipronged bet on AMC boomeranged this month on Mudrick Capital Management, the latest hedge fund to fall victim to swarming day traders.

---

The S&P 500 gained 0.2% to notch another record close, while the Nasdaq and Dow rose 0.4% and 0.04%, respectively.

---

Google pledged to collaborate with U.K. regulators on the removal of a user-tracking technology from its Chrome browser.
